OTHER GASES MAIN TABLE:  MUST BE READ IN FIRST
GWP: is gwp by gas, enter 0 to keep these from counting toward greenhouse gas emissions

column1: CAN ONLY READ IN THIS TABLE ONCE. CHANGE VALUES IN CH4/N2O FILES

column2: NOTE: Must have correct region and sector numbers below

column3: NOx -- base year emissions coefficient of US from model used as 1st guess

column1: 1.  Emission coefficients of all Asian regions are directly taken from Aardenne, John A., Anthropogenic NOx emissions in Asia in
2.  Default emission coefficient for WEUR, Canada and Aus&NewZ uses the emission coefficient for Japan from Aardenne.
Other regions like FSU, Middle East, Africa, Latin America and Eastern European uses emission coefficient from Aardenne
3.  The emission coefficients of Japan and other Asian regions are different as the OCED/IEA (data source for this study) study
assumes for all Asian countries, with exception of Japan, that no abatement technology is used.
4.  The coefficient for coal is taken as the mean of brown coal, hard coal and derived coal, and same is done for heavy fuel, medium
distillates (diesel oil) and light fraction (gasoline, LPG, kerosene)
5.  The emission coefficient for industrial wood, transportation coal and transportation wood of Asian Region is used
as the default as vaue for all other regions.
6.  Emission coefficient of Japan is used as default value for transportation wood for USA, Canada and Western Europe and
rest are same as the Other Asian Regions.
US Baseyear emission from EPA (Tg NO2)
This section of input is used to improve the emission projection from transportation (both road & non-road)

column3: NOx -- base year emissions in Tg NO2

column1: 1.   Data source for NOx emission from WEUR is from Anthropogenic annual emissions of
CO2, CH4, NOX, CO, NMVOCs and SO2, 1990-99 @
3.   Source for the rest is from EDGAR 3.2

column1: Note: Source of emission from drivers: EDGAR-HYDE 1.3

column4: Default gamma is 1;  this one is set to .5 instead to scale back industrial NOx emissions over time
